result.execSummary:
The defendant Maria Melgoza Millan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant is to complete parenting class.
-Comply with the CHIPS case.
-No violent contact with the victim.
-DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - one year (06/07/2018)

1:20 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Donna Fiedler present in court via telephone.  Statement by defendant, has paid a $100.00.  Statement by Agent Fiedler - confirms payment.  Court finds the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a year in each case.  Court instructs defendant that if probation is extended again, the Court will fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.

Court adjourned at 1:22 p.m.
Probation review hearing on May 15, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Maria Melgoza Millan
Current: N6709 Hillview Rd, Saint Cloud, WI 53079 United States  (Effective: 06-07-2016)
Prior: 51 E. John St Apt C, Markesan, WI 53946 United States

11:39 A.M.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to DC in 2016CF25 and will plea to count 1 amended to Battery in 2015CF84 and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty in 15CF84 to the amended charge and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in and on 2016CF25 finds the defendant guilty as charged to count 1 and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: 

2015CF84 (Count 1) & 2016CF25 (Count 1)

SWD and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS (EACH):

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to complete parenting class.
-Comply with the CHIPS case.
-No violent contact with the victim.
-DNA sample.

Court adjourned at 11:48 a.m.
Status hearing on June 7, 2016 at 11:30 am.

10:53 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - will waive the preliminary hearing in the felony case 2016CF25.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives her right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets both cases for Status Hearing on June 7, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:55 a.m.
Status hearing on May 10, 2016 at 10:30 am.

1:33 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  2016CF25 - Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for both cases for Status Hearing on May 10, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:35 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-15-2016 01:30 pm

Court adjourned at 2:29 p.m.
